translator.minionModel
Class MinionModel

java.lang.Object
  translator.minionModel.MinionModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
MinionGlobals
public class MinionModel
extends Object
implements MinionGlobals

MinionModel represents a constraint model for the solver Minion. Notes (ian): 1. All variable references are stored relative to a particular type. Allows variables to be added at any time. 1. When Minion gets sparse discrete need to add. 2. 2d, 3d matrices unimplemented. 3. Fix print statement. Make convention 1st 2d mx is the one. 4. NB Anywhere a var can appear, a const can. 5. Table Cts: Frisch intends given 2d matrix, large disj of conj 6. Lex omitted: not in E' yet. 7. No reif yet. Eventually do with separate arraylists: reifMax reifyImpliesMax

Author:
andrea, ian

Constructor Detail

MinionModel

public MinionModel()
Creates a blank minion Model holding no variables or constraints.

Method Detail

add01Variable

public int add01Variable(MinionBoolVariable variable)
Creates a new boolean Minion variable and returns its (absolute) index in the model (each variable has a unique index and can only be identified by that). Since the boolean variables come first, their relative index is the same as their absolute index.

Parameters:
variable - the MinionBoolVariable that is being added to the Minion model
Returns:
the index the variable has in the Minion model

add01VariableVector

public void add01VariableVector(MinionBoolVariable[] variableVector,
                                int offset)
Creates a vector (size is specified by the parameter) of new boolean Minion variables and computes its relative index in the model (each variable has a relative index (index concerning boolean variables only) and an absolute index (index concerning all variables) and can only be identified by that). The relative index is the index of the vector.

Parameters:
variableVector - the MinionBoolVariable[] array that should be added to the translator.minionModel;
offset - TODO

Add a variableVector that is empty and will (should!) be inserted with values later

add01VariableMatrix

public void add01VariableMatrix(MinionBoolVariable[][] matrix,
                                int vectorOffset,
                                int elementOffset)
Add a matrix to the minion Model. Each element of the matrix is stored as new element and must not have been added before! The offsets of each range (vector and element-range) are stored.

Parameters:
matrix -
vectorOffset -
elementOffset -

add01VariableCube

public void add01VariableCube(MinionBoolVariable[][][] cube,
                              int matrixOffset,
                              int vectorOffset,
                              int elementOffset)
Add a cube of 0/1 variables to the Minion Model. Each element of the cube is stored as new element and must not have been added before! The offsets of each range (matrix, vector and element-range) are stored.

Parameters:
cube -
matrixOffset - is the difference between 0 and the index of the first matrix, such that firstIndex - offset = 0
vectorOffset -
elementOffset -

addBoundsVariable

public void addBoundsVariable(MinionBoundsVariable boundsVariable)
Computes the relative index of the variable and puts it into the list of Bound variables. The absolute index can only be computed after all variables have been collected.

Parameters:
boundsVariable - the MinionBoundsVariable that will be inserted into the Minion model

Parameters:
variableVector - the MinionBoundsVariable[] array that should be added to the translator.minionModel;

computeAllAbsoluteIndices

public void computeAllAbsoluteIndices()
This method should be called when all variables have been added to the Minion model. It computes the absolute index of every variable. Boolean variables are not considered, since they come first in the variable list and therefore already have their absolute index. TODO: later extend for sparse/discrete and so on bounds

addEqualityConstraint

public void addEqualityConstraint(MinionIdentifier lhs,
                                  MinionIdentifier rhs)
Parameters:
lhs - MinionIdentifier on the left hand side of the equality relation
rhs - MinionIdentifier on the right hand side of the equality relation

                                     MinionIdentifier rhs)

addInequalityConstraint

public void addInequalityConstraint(MinionIdentifier lhs,
                                    MinionIdentifier rhs,
                                    MinionConstant c)
Parameters:
lhs - MinionIdentifier on the left hand side of the inequality relation
rhs - MinionIdentifier on the right hand side of the inequality relation
c - MinionConstant that states if the relation is > or <

addProductConstraint

public void addProductConstraint(MinionIdentifier left,
                                 MinionIdentifier right,
                                 MinionIdentifier result)
Add a new product constraint to the minion model of the form left * right = result

Parameters:
left - MinionIdentifier on the left hand side of the product
right - MinionIdentifier on the right hand side of the product
result - MinionIdentifier that results from mutliplying left and right

addSumLeqVariablesConstraint

public void addSumLeqVariablesConstraint(MinionIdentifier[] expr,
                                         MinionIdentifier result,
                                         boolean useWatchedLiterals)
The less-or-equal sum has the following meaning: sumleq([v1, v2, v3, v4], v5) corresponds to v1 + v2 + v3 + v4 <= v5

Parameters:
expr - MinionIdentifier[] array that contain all identifiers that form the left hand side of the sum.
result - MinionIdentifier resulting from adding up the array expr
useWatchedLiterals - TODO

addSumGeqVariablesConstraint

public void addSumGeqVariablesConstraint(MinionIdentifier[] expr,
                                         MinionIdentifier result,
                                         boolean useWatchedLiterals)
The greater-or-equal sum has the following meaning: sumleq([v1, v2, v3, v4], v5) corresponds to v1 + v2 + v3 + v4 >= v5

Parameters:
expr - MinionIdentifier[] array that containts all identifiers that form the left hand side of the sum.
result - MinionIdentifier resulting from adding up the array expr
useWatchedLiterals - TODO

addSumConstraint

public void addSumConstraint(MinionIdentifier[] expr,
                             MinionIdentifier result,
                             boolean useWatchedLiterals)

addWeightedSumLeqConstraint

public void addWeightedSumLeqConstraint(MinionIdentifier[] vars,
                                        MinionConstant[] constants,
                                        MinionIdentifier id)
                                 throws MinionException
Add a new weighted sumleq constraint to the minion model of the form var-vector (MinionBoundsVar[]), const-vector (MinionConst[]), id (MinionIdentifier) where weightedsumleq(var-vector, const-vector, id), meaning var1*const1 + var2*const2 + ... + var_n*const_n <= id

Parameters:
vars - MinionIdentifier[] holding the variables on the left hand side of the inequation
constants - MinionConstant[] holding the variables on the left hand side of the inequation
id - MinionIdentifier representing the result of the scalar product
Throws:
MinionException

addWeightedSumGeqConstraint

public void addWeightedSumGeqConstraint(MinionIdentifier[] vars,
                                        MinionConstant[] constants,
                                        MinionIdentifier id)
                                 throws MinionException
Add a new weighted sumgeq constraint to the minion model of the form var-vector (MinionBoundsVar[]), const-vector (MinionConst[]), id (MinionIdentifier) where weightedsumleq(var-vector, const-vector, id), meaning var1*const1 + var2*const2 + ... + var_n*const_n >= id

Parameters:
vars - MinionIdentifier[] holding the variables on the left hand side of the inequation
constants - MinionConstant[] holding the variables on the left hand side of the inequation
id - MinionIdentifier representing the result of the scalar product
Throws:
MinionException

addAllDifferentConstraint

                               throws MinionException
Impose an allDifferent constraint on a known variable vector.

Parameters:
vector -
Throws:
MinionException - is thrown when the vector is unknown

addAllDifferentConstraint

public void addAllDifferentConstraint(MinionIdentifier[][] matrix,
                                      int vectorIndexInMatrix)
                               throws MinionException
Add an allDifferent constraint that is imposed on a vector of a defined matrix

Parameters:
matrix - the MinionIdentifier[][] where on the vector at index vectorIndexInMatrix an alldifferent constraint is imposed
vectorIndexInMatrix - the int index of the matrix stating on which vector the alldifferent constraint is imposed
Throws:
MinionException - is thrown when the matrix is unknown or the index is out pf bounds

addElementConstraint

public void addElementConstraint(MinionIdentifier[] vector,
                                 MinionIdentifier index,
                                 MinionIdentifier element)
                          throws MinionException
Add an element constraint to the model.

Parameters:
vector - the MinionIdentifier array containing the elements
index - the MinionIdentifier stating the index of the vector where element should be
element - the MinionIdentifier that should be in vector at index of index
Throws:
MinionException - is thrown when the vector is unknown
